author: Sefy Levy
description: Distinguish Nile/Ethiopian vs Levantine basalt sources using immobile trace elements

classifications.name: NILE/ETHIOPIAN AFFINITY

rules.comment: Characteristic Zr/Nb window for Nile/Ethiopian sources

classifications.notes: Immobile trace elements preserve mantle source signatures

classifications.name: LEVANT/GOLAN AFFINITY

rules.comment: Many Levant/Golan basalts show elevated Zr/Nb

classifications.notes: Must be checked against local datasets for confirmation

classifications.name: ARC BASALT (Ti/V < 20)
classifications.notes: Secondary tectonic proxy - combine with Zr/Nb for full interpretation

classifications.name: MORB/OIB (Ti/V > 20)
classifications.description: Mid-Ocean Ridge Basalt or Ocean Island Basalt signature
classifications.notes: Secondary tectonic proxy - combine with Zr/Nb for full interpretation

classifications.name: TRANSITIONAL / REVIEW
classifications.description: Sample falls outside defined windows or requires review
classifications.notes: Does not match primary classification windows

notes: Screening-level classification - always frame as 'affinity/window', not absolute provenance. Immobile trace elements (Zr, Nb, Ti, V) preserve mantle source signatures despite weathering and alteration.
